page.title: 20Civic Amenities
page.content: Amongst the many civic amenities in Thurso are the library and the Town Hall.Both are old buildings built in the nineteenth century. {Thurso Town Hall dominates the new {shopping precinct.It has 5 rooms {upstairs and 8 rooms downstairs.These {are used for coffee mornings,keep fit, {exhibitions,yoga and many other sales. Thurso Library has been housed in the old Miller Academy since 1967.It contains 25924 books,and at the time of Domesday there are 10546 registered readers.In the entrance hall the walls are covered with posters telling of all the clubs and activities in the town.The library costs around Â£30000 to run each year.The building also houses an art gallery,the Registrar of births,deaths and marriages,and the Children's Panel.
